intro: Weingartia arenacea subsp. menesesii, commonly known as the Menesesii barrel cactus, is a small, slow-growing cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stem that is typically green to bluish-green in color. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It has spiny areoles with clusters of white to yellow glochids, which are fine, hair-like spines. This species is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
